summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on January 27, 2012. It designates executors for his estate, bequeaths all his property to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One', and outlines extensive powers granted to the executors for managing the estate.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed and executed his last will and testament in New York, witnessed and notarized.

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One
events.description: The trust agreement that is the primary beneficiary of Epstein's estate was originally created on this date.

locations: Little St. James Island, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will, dated January 27, 2012, leaves his entire estate to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One' (created November 8, 2001).
The primary executors appointed are Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman, with Jes Staley and Andrew Farkas named as successor executors.

The will grants the executors extremely broad powers to manage the estate, including investment, sale of assets, continuation of businesses, and litigation, with significant protections from liability.
The document includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the associated trust.
The will was signed and notarized in New York by Notary Public Harry I. Beller.
